body: +1. Change looks good. JIRA is 2210 and not 2200. Changing the title will help ensure that appropriate JIRA is updated with this PR. Can merge tomorrow if there are no more comments.

This change removes HTable/Table caching on the client side of the Trafodion code.  The code to add coprocessor classes at the time of creating HTable instance is removed because it would be drag to instantiate HTable/Table for every hbase operation.  It is a non-issue with Trafodion tables because the TableDescription should have added coprocessor classes automatically at the time of create.  The vanilla hbase table access via Trafodion engine will be non-transactional unless the Trafodion co-processor classes are added to the HTableDescriptor via hbase shell.

For the existing customers who had created Trafodion tables in the very early release of Trafodion also need to add coprocessor classes via hbase shell.
Is there a JIRA?  Please edit the PR title to have [TRAFODION-XXX] at the beginning, so PR activity is logged there.

+1. Change looks good.
Amanda could you please file a JIRA or maybe simply add a sentence or two here about these fixes so that could take the place of a JIRA description?

From Steve for another PR.
"Please edit the PR title to have [TRAFODION-XXX] at the beginning, so PR activity is logged there."
So maybe a JIRA is really required. Sorry for the bother. Thanks.
Will rework after TRAFODION-2148, close now
I created TRAFODION-2214 to track this RP.

looks very good for me, except a minor suggestion. That can be fixed in a later check in from my point of view. So it is good to merge from my part.
And as Steve suggested, update the title with the new JIRA , so it can be tracked.

This is a very cool new feature.

TRAFODION-2215 created to track this issue. 
+1.
Please remember to edit PR title to include JIRA number.

Has this been fixed. If not, it would be good to create a new JIRA to return the exception to the client and then merge this PR. This PR at least makes sure that the error is returned when there is a failure

looks good

BTW, I think the double brackets in the pull-request title defeat the ASF automation. Single bracket is better.
Looks good. Have you observed the growth in C++ memory when run for a long time.

For the comment by @selvaganesang : I have seen this issue in 2 environments. In one case there was a growth in mem on the C++ side too. RSS memory as reported by TOP grew to 3 GB for mxosrvr. I have a gcore and will analyze that next. In my test env, I did not observe a similar growth on C++ side, but that could be because I did not run the query sufficient number of times. I will try it out, and if additional issues are found, I hope it can be addressed in a different PR. Thank you for the review and help in understanding this problem.

For the comment by @DaveBirdsall : This used be a bug in gcc, which has been fixed in the version of gcc we use. Please see https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=28178 . I also tested by explicitly adding this line to the method that was changed. There was no untoward behaviour. Thank you for the review, I had the same question as I was adding  that line, but went on without doing these checks.
jni->DeleteLocalRef(jniResult);
jni->DeleteLocalRef(NULL); // new temp line for sanity check. Not part of this PR
Should this pull request be closed now?
Please leave it open.  I'm still working this code.

The jdbc test failure with an internal error is unrelated to the changes.
Looks good to me.  I would think we need to document that the tables created by user shouldn't start with 'TRAF_SAMPLE_".
The extra test failures don't seem to be related to this change, the failures happened before any tests could be run, one is on CDH, which is unaffected by this change.
@selvaganesang, thanks for the suggestion. I will follow up on it when addressing  JIRA TRAFODION-2164.
Could we submit this to https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/TRAFODION/Trafodion+Code+Examples instead? I think that would be a better match.

The extra test problem was on HDP side, but agree that it was a machine set-up issue and unrelated to these changes.

The change looks good to me.
Change looks good to me. Sorry for the long discussion.

+1 Thanks Hans. 

Do we need /usr/hdp/current/hadoop-yarn-client/lib/\* also in our classpath  or those are already included ?

@arvind-narain, good question. I (accidentally) tried without the jars in /usr/hdp/current/hadoop-yarn-client/lib/\* and that worked, so I didn't include them. Someday, the code may change and make this a requirement. Let me know if you feel we should add the other jars as a defensive measure. I'm just a bit hesitant, given how rarely we use yarn and how long our CLASSPATH already is.

You are correct Hans - less we add to our CLASSPATH the better.
+1
@anoopsharma00 , @sandhyasun  , please help to review this if it is a correct fixing?
